meanings.definition: The quality of being biased or prejudiced.
meanings.sent1: Her biasness towards certain students affected her ability to grade fairly.
meanings.sent2: The biasness in the hiring process was evident when only candidates from a certain university were selected.
meanings.sent3: Despite his biasness towards chocolate, he tried to be fair and taste all the flavors.
meanings.sent4: The biasness in her decision-making was like a fog clouding her judgment.
meanings.sent5: The biasness of the judge was so strong that it colored every ruling she made.

meanings.definition: A particular tendency, trend, inclination, or feeling, especially one that is unfair or unbalanced.
meanings.sent1: The biasness of the media towards sensational news stories often distorts the public's perception.
meanings.sent2: His biasness towards always choosing the same restaurant for lunch became a running joke among his friends.
meanings.sent3: The biasness of the cat towards sleeping on the sunny spot on the couch was adorable.
meanings.sent4: The biasness of the wind towards blowing in one direction made flying a kite challenging.
meanings.sent5: The biasness of the scale towards showing a lower weight was discovered when comparing it to a calibrated one.
